intro: Hieracium bathylepium, commonly known as the deep-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are basal, with a distinctive deep green color and a rough texture. Hieracium bathylepium produces yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, adding a vibrant touch to its natural habitat.
